DOC.detailed_description: OBJECTIVES : - To compare effect advanced practice nurse , standardize nursing intervention protocol ( SNIP ) model v usual care overall quality life psychological distress patient stage I-III breast cancer , initial treatment 6 month post diagnosis . - To compare symptom control two group . - To compare geriatric assessment outcome two group . - To test effect SNIP intervention compare usual care group resource use patient . - To test effect SNIP patient ' clinician ' satisfaction care . - To describe effect SNIP patient ' management transition one phase chronic illness another . - To identify subgroups patient benefit SNIP relation sociodemographic characteristic , disease/treatment factor , geriatric assessment predictor . - To obtain feedback clinician regard interpretation finding application routine care breast cancer patient . OUTLINE : Patients enrol sequentially 1 2 group . Group 1 enrol month 4-21 group 2 enrolled month 25-54 . - Group 1 ( usual care ) : Patient questionnaire administer baseline 3 6 month . The clinician ' satisfaction care also evaluate . - Group 2 ( advanced practice nurse [ APN ] intervention ) : Patients accrue APN . Patients meet APN periodically assess physical well-being include ambulatory care need , care physical symptom ( i.e. , pain , fatigue , nausea vomit ) , psychological well-being . Questionnaires administer baseline 3 6 month . In group , questionnaire include FACT-Breast , Memorial Symptom Assessment Scale , Psychological Distress Thermometer , Comprehensive Geriatric Assessment , Patient Satisfaction Intervention . Clinicians also complete questionnaire . Patients ' medical chart also review .
